name: speckle
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a very small mark of a different colour from the area around it, usually found with a large number of other marks of the same type: A blackbird's egg is blue with brown speckles on it. Synonyms
fleck
patch
spot

(of small marks that are of a different colour to the area around them) to cover something: A few drops of blood speckled his face. Black mould infested the drawers, speckling her clothes with dark spots.
to be spread across an area or place, with gaps in between: Heavy machinery speckles the grounds, as construction crews start on the foundation. Only 17,612 people turned up to speckle an arena which was built for 73,000.
to be present in something: "Good causes" speckled the agenda like sesame seeds on a bagel. Small-scale breeders have speckled the Midwest and South since the market for purebred pet dogs exploded after World War II. Related word
speckled
